title: Developing research collaborations between Rothamsted research and Indian esearch providers
findingsText:
The Rothamsted Research Executive visited several Institutes and Research Funders in New Delhi and then divided into two groups, with Maurice Moloney (MM), Keith Gould (KG) and Angela Karp (AK) visiting Hyderabad and Peter Shewry (PS) and Martin Parry (MP) visiting Meerut and Karnal. The details of these visits are given below, with outputs.
There is no doubt that India will become a major power in research on crop improvement, and in particular in the application of genomics and other advanced approaches. The importance of wheat as a major crop in the UK and India will therefore provide unique opportunities to develop long term collaborations and partnerships, but these will depend on financial and personal commitments from both sides. The visit was the first step in enabling us to develop such partnerships, but identifying relevant partners and introducing ourselves and our research to them.
Possible collaborations established with: NIPGR; TERI; ICAR; IARI; NRCPB; Meerut; Chaudhary Charan Singh (CCS) University (formerly Meerut University); Karnal, DWR; Hyderabad ICRISAT; CRIDA  Agriculture/ Food and Drink,Environment,Manufacturing/ including Industrial Biotechology
